060b1fcc-5f90c680-8ce2e1f5-40d3ac27-2dce:
Dr. Rory Spiegel
Dr. Rory Spiegel is an Assistant Consultant in the Department of Medical Oncology at The Royal Marsden NHS Foundation Trust and Honorary Clinical Senior Lecturer at the University of Southampton. He has a particular interest in the treatment of patients with lung cancer, including those with brain metastases. His research focuses on the development of new treatments for patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and he is currently leading a number of clinical trials in this area. b0957f5e-2da32f5e-3f46e685-8b05a23b-25c9:
Dr. Xie Ying
Dr. Xie Ying is an assistant professor in the Department of Radiation Oncology at The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center. He received his medical degree from Fudan University, Shanghai, China and completed his postdoctoral training at Harvard Medical School, Boston, USA. His research interests include radiation oncology, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT) and proton therapy. Dr. Xie has published more than 100 peer-reviewed articles and book

24386f31-41e447f6-dd0abcfa-ac74f2fe-4316:
Dr. David Nieper
Dr. David Nieper is a radiologist at the Royal Marsden Hospital in Leeds, UK. He graduated from the University of Sheffield Medical School and completed his radiology training at St James's University Hospital in Leeds, UK. He has a particular interest in breast imaging and interventional radiology. His research interests include image-guided therapy for breast cancer and the role of MRI in the diagnosis and management of breast cancer.

51051faa-2f20e284-0d88407b-8415e95b-9767:
Dr. Rangan Chatterjee
Consultant: Dr. Anupama Reddy
Dr. Rangan Chatterjee is a Consultant Radiologist at the Royal London Hospital and Honorary Senior Lecturer in Radiology at the University of London, UK. He graduated from St Bartholomew’s Hospital Medical School and completed his radiology training at the Royal London Hospital. He was appointed as a Consultant Radiologist at the Royal London Hospital in 2000 and has been an Honorary Senior Lecturer in Radiology at the University of London since 2004
c558a43e-149445ab-fd0ae407-39c70cca-a8a6: Dr. Michael J. Wojciechowski is a board-certified, fellowship-trained interventional radiologist with over 20 years of experience in the diagnosis and treatment of all types of cancer. Dr. Wojciechowski received his medical degree from Georgetown University School of Medicine in Washington, D.C. He completed his residency in diagnostic radiology at the University of Maryland Medical Center in Baltimore, MD.
